meanings.definition: The realization of potentiality in actuality.
meanings.sent1: The entelechies of the acorn becoming an oak tree are truly remarkable.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the entelechies of seeds to understand plant growth better.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was filled with the buzzing entelechies of students eager to learn.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for dance was the entelechies that drove her to pursue a career in ballet.
meanings.sent5: The entelechies of hard work and dedication led to his success in the business world.

meanings.definition: A vital agent or force directing an organism toward self-fulfillment.
meanings.sent1: Love can be the entelechies that motivates someone to achieve their dreams.
meanings.sent2: The coach was seen as the entelechies behind the team's incredible performance.
meanings.sent3: Laughter acted as the entelechies that brought joy to the gloomy day.
meanings.sent4: The mentor's guidance served as the entelechies guiding the young artist to success.
meanings.sent5: Hope can be the entelechies that keeps us moving forward during tough times.

meanings.definition: The realization of potentiality in actuality.
meanings.sent1: The entelechies of a caterpillar transforming into a butterfly are truly magical.
meanings.sent2: In nature, we can witness the entelechies of growth and transformation.
meanings.sent3: The garden was alive with the colorful entelechies of blooming flowers.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brushstrokes were the entelechies that brought the painting to life.
meanings.sent5: The entelechies of hard work and perseverance led to her achieving her goals.
